newsitem.title: FRANCE: RUGBY UNION-AUCKLAND OUTCLASS EUROPEAN CHAMPIONS BRIVE.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-AUCKLAND OUTCLASS EUROPEAN CHAMPIONS BRIVE.

text.p: Super 12 champions Auckland ended their brief European tour in style with a crushing 47-11 win over European Cup winners Brive of France on Saturday.
"It was like spending 80 minutes in a washing machine," Brive captain Alain Penaud said after the New Zealand side ran in six tries to one.
Brive officials had dubbed the game an "unofficial world club championship" but it turned into a rugby lesson which highlighted once again the superiority of sides from the Southern Hemisphere.
The Auckland Blues were simply stronger, faster, more skilled technically, more cunning strategically and they hardly made any mistakes.
Centre Lee Stensness led the Auckland charge with a hat-trick of tries, while Adrian Cashmore kicked 14 points, landing four conversions and two penalties.
"It was like being run over by a bus a hundred times," said Penaud. "The 101st time, the tackling gets a bit clumsy."
Auckland now travel to South Africa to begin their Super 12 campaign.
